history.text: Hello?
Hi!
Have you seen The Blind Side before? If not, you should really watch it.
Have you seen or heard of any good movies lately?
The Blind Side? I haven't seen it yet.  Who is in it?
The main character is played by Quinton Aaron.
I haven't heard of him... is this his first movie?
He plays Micheal, and highschool football player that came from a hard childhood.
I'm not sure if he has been in anything else.
Anyway, he ends up getting adopted by this family, the mom Leigh Anne, is played by Sandra Bullock.
The father Sean, is played by Tim McGraw.
I was about to ask about any other actors and actresses I might know.
Anyway, they adopt him, and he ends up playing football for a private school.
So, they adopt this kid and he plays football?  Does anything exciting happen? or is it a drama?
It's more drama. He gets shuffled around in foster homes, and keeps running away. A friend's father ends up contacting the coach of the private school to see if they can get him in that school.
That's cool, I like dramas.  What happens when he starts playing football?
He makes friends with a kid (Leigh Anne and Sean's son). And they ended up adopting him.
He was really good and became one of the most coveted prospects in college football.
It's a true story.
Does his family not care about him or did they day?
He ended up being drafted by the Ravens.
I'm not sure what happened to his biological parents.
Is all of that in the movie, or does the movie end with just backstory from childhood?
I think his bio mom was a drug addict, and he got taken from her when he was 7 and doesn't know where she ended up.
All of it is in the movie.
Anyway, Micheal struggled in school, and to play football he had to keep his gpa a certain level.
Did the adopted mom and dad help or the little kid he made friends with?
So he ended up getting a tutor and was able to do good enough in school.
Was there any issues with the high school coach or tutor that added to the drama?
It didn't score super high with Rotten Tomatoes surprisingly.
Micheal grows suspicious wondering why they really adopted him.
Rotten Tomatoes doesn't always get it right.  Did any of the other reviewers or sites do it justice?
He ends up looking for his bio mom.
hmmmm, is that why he runs away?
Yes, but he ends up realizing the are his real family an goes back.
they*.... as in Leigh Anne and Sean
Metacritic only gave it 53/100 but CinmaScore gave it an A+
Is the realization caused by anything?  Does he find his mom or old friends or a brother and realize he doesn't belong anymore?
A+ sounds good

uid2response.feedback: It seemed the other user was a bot. the answers did flow like a human.  Also, the user left after I only had 14 responses not the 15 required, which seemed odd.
